trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
trait.text: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

trait.name: Brute
trait.text: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Surprise Attack
trait.text: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

action.name: Bashing' Banjo
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Clay Jug
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Webby Hands
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn 't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
trait.text: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
trait.text: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Grappler
trait.text: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mimic makes three attacks: two with its pseudopods and one with its bite.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

trait.name: Brute
trait.text: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Surprise Attack
trait.text: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

action.name: Morningstar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage at range.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the lycanthropickle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a pickle.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

trait.name: Immunity
trait.text: Meeseeks are immune to damage.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Brute
trait.text: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Surprise Attack
trait.text: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

action.name: Morningstar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage at range.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
trait.text: The cultist has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

monster.name: Evil Mage

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The mage is a 4th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as its spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13; +5 to hit with spell attacks). The mage knows the following spells from the wizard's spell list:
Cantrips (at will): light, mage hand, shocking grasp
1st Level (4 slots): charm person, magic missile
2nd Level (3 slots): hold person, misty step

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d8-1) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: Light, Mage Hand, Shocking Grasp, Charm Person, Magic Missile, Hold Person, Misty Step

monster.name: Flameskull
monster.speed: 0 ft., fly 40 ft. It can hover.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The flameskull sheds either dim light in a 15- foot radius, or bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 ft.. It can switch between the options as an action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The flameskull has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: If the flameskull is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 hour unless holy water is sprinkled on its remains or a dispel magic or remove curse spell is cast on them.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The flameskull is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It requires no somatic or material components to cast its spells. The flameskull has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand
1st level (3 slots): magic missile, shield
2nd level (2 slots): blur, flaming sphere
3rd level (1 slot): fireball

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The flameskull uses Fire Ray twice.

action.name: Fire Ray
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage.

monster.spells: Mage Hand, Magic Missile, Shield, Blur, Flaming Sphere, Fireball

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
trait.text: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

action.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 12 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
trait.text: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 ft. of an ally of the hobgoblin that isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn 't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
trait.text: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
trait.text: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Grappler
trait.text: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The nothic has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The nothic makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Rotting Gaze
action.text: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 ft. of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Weird Insight
action.text: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 ft. of it. The target must contest its Charisma (Deception) check against the nothic's Wisdom (Insight) check. If the nothic wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being charmed.

monster.name: Ochre Jelly
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone

trait.name: Amorphous
trait.text: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage.

reaction.name: Split
reaction.text: When a jelly that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new jellies if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new jelly has hit points equal to half the original jelly's, rounded down. New jellies are one size smaller than the original jelly.

action.name: Greatclub
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
trait.text: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The owlbear makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

monster.name: Skeleton
monster.languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
action.text: The spectator shoots up to two of the following magical eye rays at one or two creatures it can see within 90 ft. of it. It can use each ray only once on a turn.

1. Confusion Ray. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw, or it can't take reactions until the end of its next turn. On its turn, the target can't move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can't attack, it does nothing on its turn.

2. Paralyzing Ray. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

3. Fear Ray. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the spectator is visible to the target, ending the effect on itself on a success.
4. Wounding Ray. The target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Create Food and Water
action.text: The spectator magically creates enough food and water to sustain itself for 24 hours.

reaction.name: Spell Reflection
reaction.text: If the spectator makes a successful saving throw against a spell, or a spell attack misses it, the spectator can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) it can see within 30 ft. of it. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of the spectator. If the spell forced a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

action.name: Blood Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the stirge's turns, the target loses 5 (1d4 + 3) hit points due to blood loss.

The stirge can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 10 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the stirge.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the blight remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a dead shrub.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The dragon can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Zombie
monster.languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.
